image.altText: An Aboriginal ranger squats beside a muddy buffalo wallow encroaching a natural grassy floodplain that stretches behind him.

items.synopsis: Savanna burning carbon credits transformed how Indigenous rangers care for their country in northern Australia. Could the carbon market help tackle their next big threat — feral buffalo?

title.children: The carbon market has transformed how Indigenous rangers care for country. Could it happen again?

image.altText: Nathan Jones

items.synopsis: The "cliff" is here or approaching for more than a million mortgage borrowers, many of whom will see their repayments jump by thousands of dollars a month.

title.children: Millions on a 'mortgage cliff' as they roll off low-rate loans and hit a wall of repayments

image.altText: Crowds stand by the water's edge

items.synopsis: Authorities are deploying crocodile traps and have barricaded the entrance to Wangi Falls in Litchfield National Park after confirming the attack on Monday afternoon.

title.children: 'Do not enter the water': 2-metre croc attack prompts authorities to close popular NT waterfall

image.altText: Woman shown MS-2step

items.synopsis: Australia's medical regulator is changing requirements which make it difficult for doctors to prescribe medical abortions, but GPs are warning this cannot be the end of the road.

title.children: More doctors will soon be able to prescribe medical abortions under regulation changes

image.altText: Sign out the front of a country pub which states that Indgienous people will be refused takeaway alcohol service

items.synopsis: The Mataranka Hotel stopped serving takeaway alcohol to Indigenous people during a "community-led", short-term ban following the death of a woman in the nearby Jilkminggan community.

title.children: NT pub refuses to sell Indigenous people takeaway alcohol in short-term, 'community-led' ban

image.altText: Australian Prime Minister and German Chancellor shake hands and look towards the camera

items.synopsis: The Climate Club was formed last year and is an initiative of German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, and includes the United States, UK and France.

title.children: Australia joins the Climate Club alliance, pushing for net zero emissions by 2050

image.altText: Man wearing light brown military uniform looking at the camera while standing outside in the daylight

items.synopsis: The Kremlin says Russian President Vladimir Putin discussed Ukraine and the rebellion with the Wagner leader and other commanders.

title.children: Wagner boss Prigozhin met with Putin after failed mutiny

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair, wearing a pinstripe jacket, sits in the kitchen of a house.

items.synopsis: Research has shown that renters in Australia could be more likely to face physical and mental health problems than owners.

title.children: Shay thought overpricing was her biggest rental challenge. Then she realised her health was at risk

image.altText: Workers walk past the Reserve Bank of Australia exterior.

items.synopsis: We could be wreaking havoc trying to reach the 2 to 3 per cent inflation target, writes business editor Ian Verrender. What if it's a goal that is unattainable?

title.children: What if soaring rates don't kill inflation? Central banks may be about to blow up the economy

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Paul Keating

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese refuses to comment on Paul Keating's attack on the NATO secretary-general ahead of the alliance's meeting.

title.children: PM calls NATO boss a 'friend of Australia' after Keating's 'supreme fool' comment

image.altText: Boxes of feta cheese on the production line with "Protected Designation of Origin" written on the labels.

items.synopsis: The future of Australian producers using terms like prosecco and feta hangs in the balance as trade talks with the European Union over a deal that could be worth $100 billion reach a critical moment.

title.children: Crunch time for Australian prosecco and feta as trade talks resume

image.altText: An asp caterpillar sits on a green leaf

items.synopsis: Researchers are exploring how the venomous hair-like bristles on caterpillars could be used to treat cancer in the human body.

title.children: 'So much needs to be explored': How a 'cocktail' of caterpillar venom could help kill cancer cells

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

items.synopsis: More than three years after Whakaari White Island erupted and killed 22 people, New Zealand's workplace health and safety regulator will bring the owners of the volcano and several tours companies to court.

title.children: Three brothers own the NZ volcano that killed 17 Australians. Today they go on trial

image.altText: A woman addresses the media

items.synopsis: Five suburbs in Sydney's western and south-western suburbs are among New South Wales' top 10 for "rental pain", a new report finds.

title.children: NSW's first rental commissioner faces big task as new report pinpoints Sydney suburbs in pain

image.altText: a man with a beard and bald looking at the camera

items.synopsis: Basel "Baz" Brikha's family is left waiting for answers after he was killed by falling pallets at a Woolworths factory in Western Sydney.

title.children: Supermarket giant bans machinery that caused death of 'gentle giant' at Sydney site

image.altText: Woman in mask shopping in Woolworths packaged food aisle June 28

items.synopsis: A Senate committee looking at cost of living issues has heard one charity estimates it is 10.5 million meals short of demand each year, while rising rents mean many are forced to choose between overcrowding or living rough.

title.children: 'The problems are so enormous': Food, private rentals unaffordable for many Tasmanians

image.altText: A tennis player with hands on hips argues with a chair umpire at Wimbledon.

items.synopsis: Tears, injuries, upsets and a harsh interpretation of the laws of tennis cause controversy at The All England Club, while Novak Djokovic just keeps on winning.

title.children: 'It's the wrong decision': Russian teen lashes Wimbledon umpire over point penalty controversy

image.altText: A child lies on a snow-covered ground making a snow angel.

items.synopsis: Residents of South Africa's biggest city Johannesburg are stunned by the first snowfall in over a decade on Monday.

title.children: Johannesburg sees first snow in a decade

image.altText: Manasseh Sogavare shakes hands with his Chinese counterpart Li Qiang in front of flags from both of their countries.

items.synopsis: At Beijing's Great Hall of the People, Manasseh Sogavare meets his Chinese counterpart Li Qiang and the pair sign nine agreements, including one on policing that is set to run for the next few years.

title.children: China and Solomon Islands sign diplomatic agreements, including police cooperation deal

image.altText: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz smiling.

items.synopsis: The prime minister boosts Australia's climate, trade and defence cooperation with Germany during a meeting with Chancellor Olaf Scholz.

title.children: 'Never been closer': Australia and Germany strengthen ties

image.altText: A bus on fire on a bridge

items.synopsis: A bus has erupted into flames on Melbourne's West Gate Bridge, bringing traffic to a standstill.

title.children: Bus bursts into flames on Melbourne's West Gate Bridge

image.altText: A book cover reading 'Special Operations Group' by Christophe Glasl

items.synopsis: A chapter detailing author Christopher Glasl's involvement during the Port Arthur massacre has been called inaccurate by Victoria Police.

title.children: Victoria Police questions former officer's memoir detailing Port Arthur massacre

image.altText: A police cordon is placed across a road, with a large crowd gathered near buildings running along the street.

items.synopsis: A 25-year-old male suspect has been arrested after the latest mass stabbing at a kindergarten in China, where several other fatal attacks targeting students and schools have occurred nationwide in recent years.

title.children: Six killed, including three children, in China kindergarten attack

image.altText: View of sea lion showing sea lion head looking at two dolphins and a ball of bait fish

items.synopsis: Cameras are fitted to endangered Australian sea lions in a bid to document their foraging habitats, but the results have revealed so much more to excited researchers, including a snappy encounter with a shark.

title.children: Sea lion cam the 'best live TV you can watch' as researchers take a plunge with endangered seals

image.altText: The exterior of Crown Casino in Melbourne under a blue sky.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for gambling giant Crown have urged a judge not to "interfere" in an agreement over a multi-million dollar money laundering fine.

title.children: Crown Resorts lawyers urge judge not to 'interfere' in money-laundering fine agreement

image.altText: man in a t-shirt standing in front of a beach sunset

items.synopsis: A 48-year-old man was arrested near Nambucca Heads on the NSW Mid North Coast on Friday, more than 300 kilometres from where police allege he stole a dog.

title.children: Man accused of stealing Bowie the blind Gold Coast dog faces court

image.altText: Noel Pearson stands at a microphone.

items.synopsis: Famous Indigenous elders from across the country have gathered to speak on the importance of Yes votes in the Voice referendum. They say it's our chance to 'seize history' and make a real change.

title.children: 'It's our one chance': Elders make impassioned Voice plea ahead of 'most important event in 250 years'

image.altText: Drone shot of a boat parked up on a tropical island.

items.synopsis: The draft includes potential opportunities for new eco-resorts, a village centre, and cultural and nature-based activities to encourage longer stays.

title.children: Plans to revitalise abandoned party paradise on Great Barrier Reef released

image.altText: A middle-aged Indigenous woman with long hair, standing in bushland.

items.synopsis: A representative for an Indigenous family in Western Australia's Midwest has disputed a claim that a Jubilee event was stopped because of recently implemented cultural heritage laws.

title.children: 'She didn't walk this land': Decision to honour Queen brings tree-planting event to a halt

image.altText: A speed gun showing 253 kilometres per hour.

items.synopsis: A South Australian magistrate has described an L-plater who was caught doing 253 kilometres per hour as "probably the most dangerous man in the state" at that time.

title.children: Judge labels learner driver caught extreme speeding 'the most dangerous man in the state'

image.altText: Oranges in boxes branded with the business name "Nippy's".

items.synopsis: The company received a $120,000 fine and a criminal conviction over the 2020 incident. The SA Employment Tribunal found the risk had been foreseen in a safety assessment completed years before the "traumatic" accident.

title.children: Juice company Nippy's convicted over workplace scalping of 18-year-old woman

image.altText: A sign at the SA and WA border at dusk.

items.synopsis: A court has heard a passenger in a car was "totally ignorant" about more than $4 million in methylamphetamine and cocaine allegedly hidden beneath the driver's seat.

title.children: Perth woman claims she was 'totally ignorant' of $4 million worth of drugs seized at WA border

image.altText: A large round fish with huge fins and spotted skin.

items.synopsis: Xavier Doerr says his yacht capsized in huge seas when it collided with one of the ocean's strangest inhabitants. What is a sunfish? And could it take out a boat? Experts give their take.

title.children: Why rescued sailor believes one 'bizarre' fish stopped his round-Australia record bid in its tracks

image.altText: woman with glasses with serious look on face

items.synopsis: A new study will look at cancer survivors and how the fear of recurrence can impact on a person's quality of life.

title.children: Michelle Hensel survived cancer, then lost her son to the deadly disease. She now lives with the fear it could return

image.altText: two men inside a gym

items.synopsis: Tarek Zahed was denied bail for a fifth time, after the court heard he was suffering "serious health conditions" from an assassination attempt last year.

title.children: 'No good': Comanchero bikie boss refused bail over alleged Sydney murder
